title: Typical Usage
text: Let’s set health atlas. example, going use Chicago Health Atlas, can , providing Chicago Health Atlas URL ha_set(). anytime, need check health atlas using, can using ha_get(). can list topics (aka indicators) present within Chicago Health Atlas using ha_topics(). important column topic_key can used identify topic within subsequent functions. Often, may topic area interested exploring. can explore topic areas using ha_subcategories(). can use subcategory_key subset list topics . topic topics mind, can explore populations, time periods, geographic scales data available using ha_coverage(). , important columns key columns can used specify data desired.
code: library(healthatlas) ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") ha_get() #> [1] "https://chicagohealthatlas.org/api/v1/" topics <- ha_topics(progress = FALSE) topics #> # A tibble: 403 × 7 #>    topic_name           topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>    <chr>                <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 9th grade education… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #>  2 ACA marketplace enr… ENR       Number of plan s… plan selec… Access to Care   #>  3 Accidents mortality  VRAC      Number of people… count of d… Injury & Violen… #>  4 Accidents mortality… VRACR     Age-adjusted rat… per 100,00… Injury & Violen… #>  5 Active business lic… CHANVYI   Count of active … licenses p… Income           #>  6 Adult asthma         HCSATH    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #>  7 Adult asthma rate    HCSATHP   Percent of adult… % of adults Chronic Disease  #>  8 Adult binge drinking HCSBD     Number of adults… count of a… Alcohol & Drug … #>  9 Adult binge drinkin… HCSBDP    Percent of adult… % of adults Alcohol & Drug … #> 10 Adult diabetes       HCSDIA    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #> # ℹ 393 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category_name <chr> subcategories <- ha_subcategories() subcategories #> # A tibble: 30 × 3 #>    subcategory_name      subcategory_key       category_name        #>    <chr>                 <chr>                 <chr>                #>  1 Access to Care        access-to-care        Clinical Care        #>  2 Quality of Care       quality-of-care       Clinical Care        #>  3 Community Safety      community-safety-1    Physical Environment #>  4 Housing & Transit     housing-transit       Physical Environment #>  5 Pollution             pollution             Physical Environment #>  6 Resource Availability resource-availability Physical Environment #>  7 Behavioral Health     behavioral-health     Morbidity            #>  8 Chronic Disease       chronic-disease-1     Morbidity            #>  9 Infectious Disease    infectious-disease-1  Morbidity            #> 10 Injury & Violence     injury-violence-1     Morbidity            #> # ℹ 20 more rows ha_topics("diet-exercise") #> # A tibble: 20 × 7 #>    topic_name           topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>    <chr>                <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 Adult fruit and veg… HCSFV     "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  2 Adult fruit and veg… HCSFVP    "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  3 Adult physical inac… HCSPA     "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  4 Adult physical inac… HCSPAP    "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  5 Adult soda consumpt… HCSS      "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  6 Adult soda consumpt… HCSSP     "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  7 Easy access to frui… HCSFVA    "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  8 Easy access to frui… HCSFVAP   "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  9 High School fruit a… YRFV      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 10 High School fruit a… YRFVP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 11 High School physica… YRPA      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 12 High School physica… YRPAP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 13 High School physica… YRPI      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 14 High School physica… YRPIP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 15 High School soda co… YRSO      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 16 High School soda co… YRSOP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 17 Middle School physi… YRMPA     "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 18 Middle School physi… YRMPAP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 19 Middle School physi… YRMPI     "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 20 Middle School physi… YRMPIP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category_name <chr> coverage <- ha_coverage("HCSFVAP", progress = FALSE) coverage #> # A tibble: 168 × 7 #>    topic_key population_key population_name population_grouping period_key #>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      #>  1 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2022-2023  #>  2 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2023       #>  3 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2021-2022  #>  4 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2022       #>  5 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2020-2021  #>  6 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2021       #>  7 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2020       #>  8 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2018       #>  9 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2017       #> 10 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2016       #> # ℹ 158 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: layer_key <chr>, layer_name <chr>

title: Typical Usage
text: Now, can import data using ha_data() specifying keys identified .
code: ease_of_access <- ha_data(   topic_key = "HCSFVAP",   population_key = "",   period_key = "2022-2023",   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) ease_of_access #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-35 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  57.9          6.86 #>  2 1714000-36 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  54.7          6.25 #>  3 1714000-37 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  45.5          7.45 #>  4 1714000-38 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  56.9          5.86 #>  5 1714000-39 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  52.4         10.5  #>  6 1714000-4  HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  71.7          5.49 #>  7 1714000-40 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  36.8          6.73 #>  8 1714000-41 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  65.9          7.52 #>  9 1714000-42 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  48.4          8.27 #> 10 1714000-1  HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  56.7          4.96 #> # ℹ 67 more rows

title: Typical Usage
text: can check layers can import ha_layers(). Since just downloaded data Community Area level, let’s import Community Area geographic layer ha_layer(). Let’s map data!  map looks pretty good, perhaps point layer may provide insight spatial variation ease access fruits vegetables. can use ha_point_layers() list point layers available Chicago Health Atlas. Grocery store locations may important aspect ease access fruits vegetables. can import layer providing point_layer_uuid ha_point_layer(). Now imported grocery stores, let’s layer top map.  expected, seems areas grocery stores higher percent adults report easy get fresh fruits vegetables. typical use case healthatlas, explored every function healthatlas offer. Now ’s time explore.
code: layers <- ha_layers() layers #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   layer_name      layer_key    layer_description                       layer_url #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>                                   <chr>     #> 1 Community areas neighborhood The city of Chicago is divided into 77… https://… #> 2 ZIP Codes       zip          The ZIP code is a basic unit of geogra… https://… #> 3 Census Tracts   tract-2020   Census tracts are small geographies de… https://… #> 4 Chicago         place        Cities, towns, villages, and boroughs,… https://… community_areas <- ha_layer("neighborhood") library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2)  map_data <- community_areas |>   left_join(ease_of_access, "geoid")   plot <- ggplot(map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), alpha = 0.7) +   scale_fill_distiller(palette = "GnBu", direction = 1) +   labs(     title = "Easy Access to Fruits and Vegetables within Chicago",     fill = "Percent of adults who reported\nthat it is very easy for them to\nget fresh fruits and vegetables."   ) +   theme_minimal() plot point_layers <- ha_point_layers() point_layers #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    point_layer_name                      point_layer_uuid point_layer_descript…¹ #>    <chr>                                 <chr>            <chr>                  #>  1 Acute Care Hospitals - 2023           67f58fa0-0dfa-4… ""                     #>  2 Chicago Public Schools - 2023         5a449804-a2cc-4… ""                     #>  3 Federally Qualified Health Centers -… 22f48fd6-ee98-4… ""                     #>  4 Federally Qualified Health Centers (… f224b3ce-6d83-4… ""                     #>  5 Grocery Stores                        7d9caf3c-75e6-4… "All chain grocery st… #>  6 Hospitals                             8768fad7-65a2-4… "https://hifld-geopla… #>  7 Nursing Homes                         379a55c7-e569-4… "https://hifld-geopla… #>  8 Pharmacies and Drug Stores            93ace519-6ba2-4… "All chain pharmacies… #>  9 Skilled Nursing Facilities - 2023     93bc497d-3881-4… ""                     #> 10 WIC Offices - 2023                    7c8e9992-4e25-4… ""                     #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​point_layer_description grocery_stores <- ha_point_layer("7d9caf3c-75e6-4382-8c97-069696a3efbf") plot +   geom_sf(data = grocery_stores, size = 0.5)

what: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: Explore Import Metopio Powered Health Atlases. Metopio helps many public health departments build curated data platforms. data platforms convenient way community members researchers explore download public health data. spirit mind, package aim make interfacing data portals within R painless reproducible. Note: unofficial R wrapper Metopio Health Atlases. package way affiliated Metopio public health departments Metopio serves. Examples Metopio health atlases include: Chicago Health Atlas: https://chicagohealthatlas.org/ Cook County Health Atlas: https://cookcountyhealthatlas.org/ Idaho Oregon Community Health Atlas: https://idahooregoncommunityhealthatlas.org/ Northern Kentucky Atlas: https://atlas.northernkentuckyusa.com/

title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: can install development version healthatlas GitHub :

title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: Set health atlas. example, going use Chicago Health Atlas, can , providing Chicago Health Atlas URL ha_set(). can list topics (aka indicators) present within Chicago Health Atlas using ha_topics(). important column topic_key can used identify topic within subsequent functions. , can explore populations, time periods, geographic scales data available using ha_coverage(). , important columns key columns can used specify data desired. Now, can import data using ha_data() specifying keys identified . Let’s create map. first, need download Community Areas geographic layer. can ha_layer(). Now can make map!
code: library(healthatlas) ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") ha_topics(progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 403 × 7 #>    topic_name           topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>    <chr>                <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 9th grade education… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #>  2 ACA marketplace enr… ENR       Number of plan s… plan selec… Access to Care   #>  3 Accidents mortality  VRAC      Number of people… count of d… Injury & Violen… #>  4 Accidents mortality… VRACR     Age-adjusted rat… per 100,00… Injury & Violen… #>  5 Active business lic… CHANVYI   Count of active … licenses p… Income           #>  6 Adult asthma         HCSATH    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #>  7 Adult asthma rate    HCSATHP   Percent of adult… % of adults Chronic Disease  #>  8 Adult binge drinking HCSBD     Number of adults… count of a… Alcohol & Drug … #>  9 Adult binge drinkin… HCSBDP    Percent of adult… % of adults Alcohol & Drug … #> 10 Adult diabetes       HCSDIA    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #> # ℹ 393 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category_name <chr> ha_coverage("EDA", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 132 × 7 #>    topic_key population_key population_name population_grouping period_key #>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      #>  1 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2018-2022  #>  2 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2022       #>  3 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2017-2021  #>  4 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2021       #>  5 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2016-2020  #>  6 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2015-2019  #>  7 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2019       #>  8 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2014-2018  #>  9 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2018       #> 10 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2013-2017  #> # ℹ 122 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: layer_key <chr>, layer_name <chr> data <- ha_data(   topic_key = "EDA",   population_key = "",   period_key = "2018-2022",   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) data #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-35 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.1          4.64 #>  2 1714000-36 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  98.5          4.64 #>  3 1714000-37 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.0          6.93 #>  4 1714000-38 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  97.0          4.69 #>  5 1714000-39 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  98.4          7.34 #>  6 1714000-4  EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.1          3.18 #>  7 1714000-40 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  97.5          6.86 #>  8 1714000-41 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  99.0          5.27 #>  9 1714000-42 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.3          3.63 #> 10 1714000-1  EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  93.9          2.72 #> # ℹ 67 more rows layer <- ha_layer(   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) layer #> Simple feature collection with 77 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -87.94011 ymin: 41.64454 xmax: -87.52419 ymax: 42.02305 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    layer_key    geoid     name  population state notes                  geometry #>  * <chr>        <chr>     <chr>      <int> <chr> <chr>        <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> #>  1 neighborhood 1714000-6 Lake…     103048 IL    Nort… (((-87.64102 41.95481, -… #>  2 neighborhood 1714000-8 Near…      97789 IL    Cent… (((-87.62446 41.91158, -… #>  3 neighborhood 1714000-… Aust…      96753 IL    West… (((-87.78942 41.91752, -… #>  4 neighborhood 1714000-… West…      87942 IL    West… (((-87.65686 41.91079, -… #>  5 neighborhood 1714000-… Belm…      78151 IL    Nort… (((-87.74134 41.91391, -… #>  6 neighborhood 1714000-2 West…      77139 IL    Far … (((-87.68465 42.01949, -… #>  7 neighborhood 1714000-… Loga…      71742 IL    Nort… (((-87.68284 41.93224, -… #>  8 neighborhood 1714000-… Sout…      71402 IL    West… (((-87.6874 41.83481, -8… #>  9 neighborhood 1714000-7 Linc…      70425 IL    Nort… (((-87.63182 41.93259, -… #> 10 neighborhood 1714000-… Near…      67817 IL    West… (((-87.63759 41.88624, -… #> # ℹ 67 more rows library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  map_data <- layer |>   left_join(data, "geoid")   ggplot(map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), alpha = 0.7) +   scale_fill_distiller(palette = "GnBu", direction = 1) +   labs(     title = "9th Grade Education Rate",     fill = ""   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: List combinations population, periods, geographic layers available given topic. search individual topics use ha_topics().

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
code: ha_coverage(topic_key, layer_key = NULL, keys_only = FALSE, progress = TRUE)

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: topic_key Unique ID specifying topic. layer_key Character string vector Unique IDs geographic layers. keys_only Return keys? progress Display progress bar?

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: Topic coverage tibble

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: Obtain data one topics within specified populations specified time periods geographic scale. combinations topic, population, period, layer returned. Warnings generated invalid combinations.

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
code: ha_data(   topic_key,   population_key,   period_key,   layer_key,   geometry = FALSE,   wide = FALSE,   progress = TRUE )

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: topic_key Character string vector Unique IDs specifying topics. population_key Character string vector Unique IDs population stratifications. period_key Character string vector Unique IDs time periods. layer_key Character string vector Unique IDs geographic layers. geometry Attach geometry output? wide Pivot wider row contains values topics within population specified time period geographic area? progress Display progress bar?

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: Data tibble containing value standard error topic measure.

title: Get Health Atlas Portal — ha_get
text: Get health atlas currently connected .

title: Obtain Geographic Layer — ha_layer
text: Import geographic layer sf object.

title: Obtain Geographic Layer — ha_layer
text: layer_key Unique ID geographic layer. progress Display progress bar?

title: Obtain Geographic Layer — ha_layer
text: sf geographic layer.

title: List Geographic Layers — ha_layers
text: List geographic layers available.

title: List Geographic Layers — ha_layers
text: Layer information tibble.

title: Obtain Point Layer — ha_point_layer
text: Import point layer sf object.

title: Obtain Point Layer — ha_point_layer
text: point_layer_uuid Unique ID point layer.

title: Obtain Point Layer — ha_point_layer
text: sf point layer

title: List Point Layers — ha_point_layers
text: List point layers available.

title: List Point Layers — ha_point_layers
text: Point layer information tibble.

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
text: Set health atlas connect .

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
text: ha_URL URL health atlas home page.

title: List Topic Subcategories — ha_subcategories
text: List topic subcategories, can used filter topics within ha_topics().

title: List Topic Subcategories — ha_subcategories
text: Topic subcategory tibble

title: List Topics — ha_topics
text: List topics available descriptions units.

title: List Topics — ha_topics
text: subcategory_key Unique id topic subcategory progress Display progress bar?

title: List Topics — ha_topics
text: Topics information tibble
